list.h
00001 
00028 #ifndef _H_list
00029 #define _H_list
00030 
00031 #include <deque>
00032 #include "utility.h"  // for Assert()
00033 
00034 using namespace std;
00035 
00036 class Node;
00037 
00038 template<class Element> class List {
00039 
00040  private:
00041     deque<Element> elems;
00042 
00043  public:
00044            // Create a new empty list
00045     List() {}
00046 
00047            // Returns count of elements currently in list
00048     int NumElements() const
00049         { return elems.size(); }
00050 
00051           // Returns element at index in list. Indexing is 0-based.
00052           // Raises an assert if index is out of range.
00053     Element Nth(int index) const
00054         { //Assert(index >= 0 && index < NumElements()); //TODO: bring this function back
00055           return elems[index]; }
00056 
00057           // Inserts element at index, shuffling over others
00058           // Raises assert if index out of range
00059     void InsertAt(const Element &elem, int index)
00060         { Assert(index >= 0 && index <= NumElements());
00061           elems.insert(elems.begin() + index, elem); }
00062 
00063           // Adds element to list end
00064     void Append(const Element &elem)
00065         { elems.push_back(elem); }
00066 
00067          // Removes element at index, shuffling down others
00068          // Raises assert if index out of range
00069     void RemoveAt(int index)
00070         { //Assert(index >= 0 && index < NumElements()); //TODO fix this one
00071           elems.erase(elems.begin() + index); }
00072           
00073        // These are some specific methods useful for lists of ast nodes
00074        // They will only work on lists of elements that respond to the
00075        // messages, but since C++ only instantiates the template if you use
00076        // you can still have Lists of ints, chars*, as long as you 
00077        // don't try to SetParentAll on that list.
00078     void SetParentAll(Node *p)
00079         { for (int i = 0; i < NumElements(); i++)
00080              Nth(i)->SetParent(p); }
00081 };
00082 
00083 #endif
